result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle Dean Kruczkowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Provide DNA sample & pay surcharge if required by law.

Not to handle other's money/checkbook.
No consumption of alcohol or any illegal drugs.  May take prescriptions if approved by agent and take only as ordered by doctor.
May not be in any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Defendant is not to reside with his father, J.K.
No possession or use of any debit or credit cards unless approved by agent.
Defendant not to obtain any type of loan until approved by agent.

Pay restitution - if claim ever filed.
Court remits fines and costs.
Complete all programming as deemed appropriate by COMPAS assessment and the DOC.
